verses.verse: To the chief <S%H5329>Musician<s%> upon <S%H1665>Gittith<s%>, A Psalm of <S%H623>Asaph<s%>. Sing <S%H7442>aloud<s%> unto <S%H430>God<s%> our <S%H5797>strength<s%>: make a joyful <S%H7321>noise<s%> unto the <S%H430>God<s%> of <S%H3290>Jacob<s%>. of Asaph: or, for Asaph
<S%H5375>Take<s%> a <S%H2172>psalm<s%>, and <S%H5414>bring<s%> hither the <S%H8596>timbrel<s%>, the <S%H5273>pleasant<s%> <S%H3658>harp<s%> with the <S%H5035>psaltery<s%>.
Blow <S%H8628>up<s%> the <S%H7782>trumpet<s%> in the new <S%H2320>moon<s%>, in the time <S%H3677>appointed<s%>, on our solemn <S%H2282>feast<s%> <S%H3117>day<s%>.
For this was a <S%H2706>statute<s%> for <S%H3478>Israel<s%>, and a <S%H4941>law<s%> of the <S%H430>God<s%> of <S%H3290>Jacob<s%>.

This he <S%H7760>ordained<s%> in <S%H3084>Joseph<s%> for a <S%H5715>testimony<s%>, when he went <S%H3318>out<s%> through the <S%H776>land<s%> of <S%H4714>Egypt<s%>: where I <S%H8085>heard<s%> a <S%H8193>language<s%> that I <S%H3045>understood<s%> not. through: or, against
I <S%H5493>removed<s%> his <S%H7926>shoulder<s%> from the <S%H5447>burden<s%>: his <S%H3709>hands<s%> were <S%H5674>delivered<s%> from the <S%H1731>pots<s%>. were: Heb. passed away

Thou <S%H7121>calledst<s%> in <S%H6869>trouble<s%>, and I <S%H2502>delivered<s%> thee; I <S%H6030>answered<s%> thee in the secret <S%H5643>place<s%> of <S%H7482>thunder<s%>: I <S%H974>proved<s%> thee at the <S%H4325>waters<s%> of <S%H4809>Meribah<s%>. <S%H5542>Selah<s%>. Meribah: or, Strife
<S%H8085>Hear<s%>, O my <S%H5971>people<s%>, and I will <S%H5749>testify<s%> unto thee: O <S%H3478>Israel<s%>, if thou wilt <S%H8085>hearken<s%> unto me;
There shall no <S%H2114>strange<s%> <S%H410>god<s%> be in thee; neither shalt thou <S%H7812>worship<s%> any <S%H5236>strange<s%> <S%H410>god<s%>.

I am the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> thy <S%H430>God<s%>, which <S%H5927>brought<s%> thee out of the <S%H776>land<s%> of <S%H4714>Egypt<s%>: open thy <S%H6310>mouth<s%> <S%H7337>wide<s%>, and I will <S%H4390>fill<s%> it.
But my <S%H5971>people<s%> would not <S%H8085>hearken<s%> to my <S%H6963>voice<s%>; and <S%H3478>Israel<s%> <S%H14>would<s%> none of me.

So I gave them <S%H7971>up<s%> unto their own <S%H3820>hearts'<s%> <S%H8307>lust<s%>: and they <S%H3212>walked<s%> in their own <S%H4156>counsels<s%>. unto: or, to the hardness of their hearts, or, imagination
<S%H3863>Oh<s%> that my <S%H5971>people<s%> had <S%H8085>hearkened<s%> unto me, and <S%H3478>Israel<s%> had <S%H1980>walked<s%> in my <S%H1870>ways<s%>!
I should <S%H4592>soon<s%> have <S%H3665>subdued<s%> their <S%H341>enemies<s%>, and <S%H7725>turned<s%> my <S%H3027>hand<s%> against their <S%H6862>adversaries<s%>.

The <S%H8130>haters<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> should have <S%H3584>submitted<s%> themselves unto him: but their <S%H6256>time<s%> should have endured for <S%H5769>ever<s%>. submitted: or, yielded feigned obedience: Heb. lied

He should have <S%H398>fed<s%> them also with the <S%H2459>finest<s%> of the <S%H2406>wheat<s%>: and with <S%H1706>honey<s%> out of the <S%H6697>rock<s%> should I have <S%H7646>satisfied<s%> thee. finest: Heb. fat of wheat
